Comment:
Hi everyone!

In this game my opponent transposes the Ruy Lopez into the Fried Liver Attack.  This type of attack will lure Henry onto e6 before he has time to tuck himself away on the kingside.  Somehow he manages it.  White proceeds with his attack but leaves a vital pawn undefended.  This ushers in our familiar Chessic Grim Reaper, Old Matey.  White had no escape.  So, how did it happen?  Well read on or look at the Gameknot Analysis below. http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=25632898&fb=1&rnd=0.5978942071417577

23. Nxg8?? - this is the move which will effect white's demise.  I nearly recaptured but thankfully saw that the f2 pawn was hanging before hitting the submit button.  I pressed reset and then Qxf2 ........
....... CHEEEECK! Yup, here is Glenda in all her splendour.  White has only one move.

24. ..... Ne3!! - SPLAAT - this kills white stone dead.  With this counter-sac white can take the knight with either the rook or the queen but Old Matey will still descend on g2 due to Fou Leblanc sitting quietly and innocuously on b7 but also attacking g2.  White sees this and waves the white flag.
